biography.value:
The ancient war machines known as collectors lumber aimlessly across the blasted plains of Acheron until they are called upon by a necromancer to bolster the ranks of a conquering army on the Material Plane. These fearsome Constructs obey their summoners until they are dismissed back to Acheron, but if a summoner comes to a bad end, a cadaver collector might wander the Material Plane for centuries, collecting corpses while searching for a way to return home.

Cadaver collectors respond to a summons from a mortal only when they are called to the scene of a great battle—either where one is in progress, where one is imminent, or where one once took place. They encase themselves in the armor and weapons of fallen warriors and impale the corpses of those warriors on the lances and other weapons embedded in their salvaged armor.

Corpses that accumulate on a cadaver collector’s shell aren’t just grisly battle trophies. A cadaver collector can summon the spirits of these cadavers to battle against its enemies. Although these specters are individually weak, a cadaver collector can call up an almost endless supply of them, if given enough time.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

languages.custom: understands all languages but can’t speak

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The collector makes two Slam attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 3d10 type=necrotic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The collector releases paralyzing gas in a 30-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save con 18 format=long]] or be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for 1 minute. A &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. The collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Unusual &Reference[nat]{Nature}. The collector doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The collector calls up the enslaved spirits of those it has slain; 1d4 specter;specters (without Sunlight Sensitivity; see the Monster Manual) arise in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of it. The specters act right after the collector on the same initiative count and fight until they’re destroyed. They disappear when the collector is destroyed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Summon Specters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Summon Specters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
